channel.title: Hi guys
channel.description: have a little bit of a problem, i have 2 hard drives from my old computer that i wanted to transfer the stuff on those hard drives, to my new computer. i put the first one in replace of the d drive it worked fine. but now i put the other in and it won't work. the device installed correctly, i'm using the same cables but the driver won't show up. i don't know if its cause its not in slave? (there aren't any jumpers) or that maybe the drivers didn't install correctly cause last time they made me restart before i did anything. inb4 your an idiot, all that other shit. any help is welcomed.

item.title: Hi guys
item.dc:creator: @Not_X_A_Alex Not X A Alex
item.description:
@Not_X_A_Alex wrote:

Yeah, if no one else suggests anything then that’ll have to do.

Read full topic

item.title: Hi guys
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

I’m really not sure, I’ve never had a problem with hard drives :s usually shut down, plug in, start up, and it’s good to go.

Also, for option two, just make two trips

Read full topic

item.title: Hi guys
item.dc:creator: @Not_X_A_Alex Not X A Alex
item.description:
@Not_X_A_Alex wrote:

Yes, and I suppose I could do that, but thats alot of work. I dunno, If I still can’t I’ll end up doing it.
I went to the winblows thing, and checked the status. It says its working, though when I try and populate it, nothing happens… which makes me think it can’t read it. I uninstalled the drivers and reinstalled them, disabled and enabled, nothing is working. Its weird, the harddrive in my coumputer and the one I’m trying to xfer stuff off are both seagate.

edit: the other (good) harddrive is only 80 gigs, I have like 120 gigs of stuff on my old pc. :\

Read full topic

item.title: Hi guys
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Put them both in your old computer, transfer everything to the drive the works in the new computer, and install the old good drive in the new pc?

In your new pc, are you using the same connectors for the second drive as you used for the first drive that worked?

Read full topic

item.title: Hi guys
item.dc:creator: @Not_X_A_Alex Not X A Alex
item.description:
@Not_X_A_Alex wrote:

have a little bit of a problem, i have 2 hard drives from my old computer that i wanted to transfer the stuff on those hard drives, to my new computer. i put the first one in replace of the d drive it worked fine. but now i put the other in and it won’t work. the device installed correctly, i’m using the same cables but the driver won’t show up. i don’t know if its cause its not in slave? (there aren’t any jumpers) or that maybe the drivers didn’t install correctly cause last time they made me restart before i did anything.
inb4 your an idiot, all that other shit.
any help is welcomed.
